intro: Hieracium lachenalii subsp. chenopodioides, commonly known as the Chenopodioides hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its subspecies status reflects subtle morphological differences from the main species, H. lachenalii.
